answers.author: Pooja Varma
answers.text:
Hello, 
There are several useful Documents under the Volunteer and Budgeting topic pages of the Knowledge Network. You may want to start with:  
Managing Volunteers in a City- provides tips on recruitment and training.  
http://icma.org/en/icma/knowledge_network/documents/kn/Document/7776/Managing_Volunteers_in_a_City 
City of Roseville, CA’s volunteer handbook and Supervisors’ guide to managing volunteers describe volunteer process including selection.  
http://icma.org/en/icma/knowledge_network/documents/kn/Document/301772/Volunteer_Handbook 
http://icma.org/en/icma/knowledge_network/documents/kn/Document/301770/Volunteer_Supervisor_Handbook 
You may also want to look at the Multnomah County, Oregon case study called “Citizen Budget Advisory Committees Provide Oversight” that provides the volunteer forms, duties, memorandums and recommendations of the committee.  
http://icma.org/en/icma/knowledge_network/documents/kn/Document/9087/Citizen_Budget_Advisory_Committees_Provide_Oversight 
I hope this is helpful, 
Pooja Varma 
International City/County Management Association 
Knowledge Network Intern 
pvarma@icma.org

text: In order to decrease budget, there are certain kind of council activities or programme need to be done voluntarily. What are the best practices to get 'real' volunteers in helping the council to find these people?
title: Steps taken by council to find 'real' volunteers
